body:
Hey guys now this is a little different but it pertains to minecraft singleplayer.  Today i was finishing my prison i was building when i took a look at some of the signs i had around the place.  every sign had the word null on them.  i don't have screenshots because i broke the signs in fright.  I didn't type the word null.  some of the signs looked like this:

"Hospital"
null
null
null
first of all those "" i didn't type and the null stuff i can't even explain.  I check Youtube about this and this is what i found https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=IHd5YBDwNrA please check this out and reply to me.  Please no hate comments because i am quite scared.  Thank you

-Tarheelkiwi

replies.body:
Null in Java means empty, 0, N/A, ect afiak

It's probably just a glitch with Java, Herobrine doesn't exist and never will.

Edit:
"null is the reserved constant used in Java to represent a void reference i.e a pointer to nothing. Internally it is just a binary 0, but in the high level Java language, it is a magic constant, quite distinct from zero, that internally could have any representation." - http://mindprod.com/jgloss/null.html

replies.body:
The person clearly doesn't exist but there is indeed a glitch where the nbt datas of some blocks/entities disappear. Examples:

  • Item Frames
  • Chests
  • Signs
  • Some armor on mobs
  • Item names
  • Command blocks commands
replies.body_tagged:
The person clearly doesn't exist but there is indeed a glitch where the nbt datas of some blocks/entities disappear. Examples:

  • Item Frames
  • Chests
  • Signs
  • Some armor on mobs
  • Item names
  • Command blocks commands
